Additional Materials: Electronic calculator <|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[93, 386, 386, 402]]<|/det|> ## READ THESE INSTRUCTIONS FIRST <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 412, 718, 427]]<|/det|> Write your Centre number, candidate number and name on all the work you hand in. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[93, 428, 320, 441]]<|/det|> Write in dark blue or black pen. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[93, 442, 460, 456]]<|/det|> You may use a pencil for any diagrams or graphs. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[93, 456, 598, 470]]<|/det|> Do not use staples, paper clips, highlighters, glue or correction fluid. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[93, 482, 281, 495]]<|/det|> Answer all the questions. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 496, 675, 540]]<|/det|> Give non- exact numerical answers correct to 3 significant figures, or 1 decimal place in the case of angles in degrees, unless a different level of accuracy is specified in the question. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 540, 600, 568]]<|/det|> The use of an electronic calculator is expected, where appropriate. You are reminded of the need for clear presentation in your answers. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 579, 650, 638]]<|/det|> At the end of the examination, fasten all your work securely together. <|ref|>title<|/ref|><|det|>[[380, 73, 571, 88]]<|/det|>
Mathematical Formulae  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[418, 165, 535, 181]]<|/det|>
## 1. ALGEBRA  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 196, 232, 212]]<|/det|>
Quadratic Equation  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[117, 225, 382, 243]]<|/det|>
For the equation \(ax^{2} + bx + c = 0\)  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[400, 243, 549, 281]]<|/det|>
\[x = \frac{-b\pm\sqrt{b^{2} - 4ac}}{2a}\]  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 313, 221, 328]]<|/det|>
Binomial Theorem  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[223, 335, 725, 371]]<|/det|>
\[(a + b)^{n} = a^{n} + \binom{n}{1} a^{n - 1}b + \binom{n}{2} a^{n - 2}b^{2} + \ldots +\binom{n}{r} a^{n - r}b^{r} + \ldots +b^{n},\]  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[117, 380, 492, 415]]<|/det|>
where \(n\) is a positive integer and \(\binom{n}{r} = \frac{n!}{(n - r)!r!}\)  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[384, 482, 567, 498]]<|/det|>
## 2. TRIGONOMETRY  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 514, 152, 528]]<|/det|>
Identities  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[400, 542, 555, 610]]<|/det|>
\[\sin^{2}A + \cos^{2}A = 1\] \[\sec^{2}A = 1 + \tan^{2}A\] \[\csc^{2}A = 1 + \cot^{2}A\]  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 641, 234, 656]]<|/det|>
Formulae for \(\Delta ABC\)  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[384, 664, 567, 696]]<|/det|>
\[\frac{a}{\sin A} = \frac{b}{\sin B} = \frac{c}{\sin C}\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[380, 715, 570, 770]]<|/det|>
\[a^{2} = b^{2} + c^{2} - 2bc\cos A\] \[\Delta = \frac{1}{2} bc\sin A\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 73, 92, 91]]<|/det|>
<label>1</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 72, 423, 92]]<|/det|>
Solve the inequality \(4x - 9 > 4x(5 - x)\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 73, 94, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>2</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 73, 144, 92]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 73, 839, 120]]<|/det|>
It is given that \(\mathbb{C}\) is the set of integers, \(P\) is the set of prime numbers between 10 and 50, \(F\) is the set of multiples of 5, and \(T\) is the set of multiples of 10. Write the following statements using set notation.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 135, 180, 154]]<|/det|>

18 is not a multiple of 5.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[846, 228, 876, 246]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 72, 811, 107]]<|/det|>
The normal to the curve \(y = x^{3} + 6x^{2} - 34x + 44\) at the point \(P\) (2, 8) cuts the \(x\)-axis at \(A\) \(y\)-axis at \(B\). Show that the mid-point of the line \(AB\) lies on the line \(4y = x + 9\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 87, 94, 106]]<|/det|>
<label>7</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 72, 821, 166]]<|/det|>
In this question \(\begin{pmatrix} 1 \\ 0 \end{pmatrix}\) is a unit vector due east and \(\begin{pmatrix} 0 \\ 1 \end{pmatrix}\) is a unit vector due north. At 1200 a coastguard, at point \(O\), observes a ship with position vector \(\begin{pmatrix} 16 \\ 12 \end{pmatrix}\) km relative to \(O\). The ship is moving at a steady speed of \(10\mathrm{kmh}^{- 1}\) on a bearing of \(330^{\circ}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 189, 144, 208]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 180, 749, 217]]<|/det|>

<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 363, 143, 381]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 361, 875, 381]]<|/det|>

<mark>[2]

<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 72, 803, 107]]<|/det|>
An art gallery displays 10 paintings in a row. Of these paintings, 5 are by Picasso, 4 Monet and 1 by Turner.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 119, 180, 136]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 117, 880, 153]]<|/det|>
Find the number of different ways the paintings can be displayed if there are no restrictions.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[846, 134, 876, 152]]<|/det|>
<mark>[1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 304, 180, 322]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 303, 875, 338]]<|/det|>
Find the number of different ways the paintings can be displayed if the paintings by each of the artists are kept together.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[848, 318, 876, 337]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 583, 146, 600]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 583, 816, 616]]<|/det|>
A committee of 4 senior students and 2 junior students is to be selected from a group of 6 senior students and 5 junior students.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 630, 180, 648]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 630, 728, 648]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 73, 705, 90]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 103, 850, 135]]<|/det|>
Calculate the number of different committees which can be selected if at most one these cousins is included.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[848, 120, 876, 138]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 72, 808, 107]]<|/det|>
The remainder when the expression \(x^{3} + 9x^{2} + bx + c\) is divided by \(x - 2\) is the remainder when the expression is divided by \(x - 1\). Show that \(c = 24\).

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[648, 0, 999, 240]]<|/det|>
